intro: Habranthus gameleirensis, commonly known as the Cape bellflower, is a perennial herb native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
